intro: Impatiens nanlingensis, commonly known as the Nanling Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
